\abstract{We consider the classical theory of the Dirac massive particle 
in the Riemann-Cartan spacetime. We demonstrate that the translational and 
the Lorentz gravitational moments, obtained by means of the Gordon type 
decompositions of the canonical energy-momentum and spin currents, are 
consistently coupled to torsion and curvature, as expected.}

\section{Introduction}

Riemann-Cartan geometry arises naturally in the gauge theory of
the Poincar\'e group, see e.g. \cite{AT,PR}. One can interpret spacetime
coframe $\vartheta^\alpha$ and local Lorentz connection $\Gamma_\alpha
{}^\beta$ as the gravitational potentials related to the translation
group and the Lorentz group, respectively. The two-forms of torsion 
and curvature, $T^\alpha:=d\vartheta^\alpha +\Gamma_\beta{}^\alpha\wedge
\vartheta^\beta$, $R_\alpha{}^{\beta}:=d\Gamma_\alpha{}^\beta + 
\Gamma_\gamma{}^\beta\wedge \Gamma_\alpha{}^\gamma$, 
represent the corresponding gauge field strengths.
